main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted over Opa-Locka, Florida on March 16, 1963.
interesting points: The object was described as a couple of lights that were bigger and brighter than stars or planets, with the color being orange and whitish or reddish-orange.
The lights were widely spaced and the object was stationary, hovering at an altitude of 1000-2000 feet.
The sighting was reported to the Air Force and investigated under Project Blue Book.
The observer was a private citizen who wrote to the President about multiple sightings of objects that could change speed, position and direction in ways unlike any known aircraft.
The observer did not have a camera to take photographs of the objects.
